root: ^With a long and shaky breath, Iyu returned from Vaharano's embrace to the world of Serzahnk. One by one his senses returned.
^The scent of fresh snow. The cold embrace of early fall in the snowy tundra.
^The sounds of the nearby ancient towers creaking in the soft northerly winds.
^The ebbing and flowing of magic power tinged with a certain gloominess.

^Sat in a tree overlooking Fyra's borders, his aging eyes opened to behold the world. Miles and miles of blindingly bright snow stretched in every direction, interrupted only by the occassional artifact or mountain range.
^Hissing in pain, his gloved hand shot up to block the snow as he slammed his eyes shut.

^Grunting more in irritation than pain, he blindly grasped for the leather straps of his snowblockers and pulled them over his eyes with a dull snap. The throbbing pain faded away and with a sharp breath he pulled himself up from the branch, opening his eyes once more.
^His stiff muscles complained, drawing a grunt from him as he caught his breath, but with a steadying hand against the old tree he swung his feet over the side to survey Fyra's southernmost border.

^Underneath, his pack and sword lazily polished the bark of the branch he'd set them on as they swung in the wind. After a couple more steadying breaths, the old Firryn's mind sharpened.  He began this day by...

Prayer: ^The memory of the dream still dancing in his head, Iyu sighed. Perhaps he'd give praying to the Gods another chance. Though to which would he pray? He closed his eyes and focused, trying to remember all the Gods and their portfolios.
